Art. 4.92. 
Offer of a report in kind
The heir required to make a contribution in kind 
may fulfil his obligation by contributing the property given in kind, provided that it still belongs to him and that it is free of any encumbrance or occupation to which it was not already subject at the time of the gift.
   This ratio gives rise to the payment of a balance to be borne by the estate, if the value of the property transferred in kind exceeds the value to be transferred as defined in article 4.90, ¤¤ 2 and 3.
   If the value of the property reported in kind is less than the value to be reported, a balance is payable to the estate by the heir required to report.
